Key Match Events: Jalen Johnson scored 29 points and led the Hawks to a 126-111 victory over the Pelicans
The Hawks pulled away with a 14-0 run in the middle of the fourth quarter that made it 116-97
The Pelicans were outscored 66-32 in the paint
Pre-Game Insights: Zion Williamson was scratched from the lineup with right hamstring tightness
Brandon Ingram was the club’s only usual starter in uniform
The Pelicans were also without starters Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, and Herb Jones, along with prominent reserve Trey Murphy III
The Hawks played without starter De’Andre Hunter, plus rotation players Bogdan Bogdanovic, Vit Krejci and Kobe Bufkin due to injury
Post-Match Reflections: Daniels and Nance celebrated their performances against the team that traded them
Young reserves hustled but lacked the firepower to stay with Atlanta
Jordan Hawkins scored 19 points, Brandon Boston Jr. and Jamal Cain each scored 14
